written permission 3 pattern construction & brief the cardigan is worked top-down with raglan shaping beginning at the neckline a two-colour double-knit neckband is worked first short row raise the back neck for fit the yoke is worked flat in half brioche with increases on rs row only sleeves are placed on hold at the underarm the body is continued flat and sleeves are then worked in the round the hem is finished with an integrated double-knit band the pattern is divided into sections and subsections to help you find your place easily ✨ designer s note for knitters half brioche relaxes and grows with wear expect the fabric to soften and lengthen slightly over time measure your garment without stretching and consider stopping sleeve length slightly shorter than your usual preference stitch pattern & specials two-colour half brioche worked flat co an even number of stitches row 1a mc *sl1yo p1* row 1b cc slip work back to the right end of your needle *brk p1* row 2a mc turn work around *k1 sl1yo* row 2b cc slide work back to the right end of your needle *k1 brp* half brioche in the round co an even number of stitches round 1 cc sl1yo p1 round 2 mc brk p1 make sure you pick the right dominant colour colour you brk with double knit 1×1 rib two-colour work knit stitches in the colour facing you slip the opposite-colour stitches as required to form a clean reversible fabric
